newsitem.title: USA: Perceptron sees Q1 EPS $0.12-0.14 before Autospect.
newsitem.headline: Perceptron sees Q1 EPS $0.12-0.14 before Autospect.

text.p: Perceptron Inc said Tuesday it expects first quarter net income for it alone to be in the range of $0.12 to $0.14 a share -- before an expected $0.04 a share reduction in earnings due to its recent acquisition of Autospect Inc.
A year ago, Perceptron earned $0.12 a share after a $0.04 a share compensation charge.

Perceptron also said its new order bookings for the first quarter were $17.7 million, more than double the $8.7 million for the comparable period last year. The bookings for both periods include Autospect.
At March 31, backlog stood at a record $28 million, Perceptron said.

Bookings for the first quarter include two new first-tier supplier orders totaling approximately $2.2 million. In addition, a new second quarter order was received by the company's South Korean office for a major automotive system, totaling about $600,000.

Commenting on first quarter results, the company said consolidated results for the first quarter are expected to be in the range of $0.08 to $0.10 per share, compared with $0.11 per share in the first quarter of 1996.
The company said it expects Autospect to be accretive to earnings for the year.

It added that revenues for the combined companies of Perceptron and Autospect are expected to be about $10.2 million, a record for a first quarter. Combined revenues for the comparable prior year period were $9.5 million.

"...(B)ased upon the current outlook, we expect the second quarter of 1997 to show a marked improvement over the first quarter, as well as over the second quarter of 1996," Alfred Pease, chairman, said in a statement. "In addition, we would expect the continued strong demand for our products to be reflected in our 1997 results."
Perceptron manufactures and markets information-based process measurement and guidance solutions for industry.
